results.title: An Age of revolutions
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
A survey of the impact of the French Revolution from 1789, through the 1838, 1848 revolutions to the Paris Commune of 1871.

results.title: An Age of Revolutions. Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Revolution, nationalism, liberty, war, and industrialisation, were the main themes in the history of Europe from 1789 to 1870. This looks at the effects of the two main revolutions in this time, on the whole of Europe. The French Revolution brought new ideas and politics, and the Industrial Revolution brought new wealth and motives, and an urban industrialised society

results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:

results.title: Myths of nationalism
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Towards the end of the 19th century, there was, in Europe, a second wave of industrialisation with a more advanced technology. This considers each of the major powers within Europe in relation to this new technology, in the years leading up to the Great War of 1914-18.

results.title: An Oriental city: Canton China
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens, Louis De Rochemont and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description: In ancient oriental cities where there is contact with other countries through trade, there is an incongruous mixture of modern ways with the old. Canton is an old city steeped in the traditions of many generations. Its location of the Si River makes it an important centre of commerce and industry.

results.title: Highlands of the Andes
results.creator_credit: Jules Bucher, Louis de Rochemont Associates and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
A description of the Andes of Peru and the mineral resources of the area. Shows the people working in the gold, silver and copper mines, also farmers cultivating the poor, rocky soil.

results.title: The Lumber states (USA - the Pacific Northwest)
results.creator_credit: Louis de Rochemont Associates and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
A survey of the lumbering industry of the North Western States of USA. Draws attention to the careful planning necessary for the best use of the forests; seed blocks and logging areas must be organised and new forests started to maintain the timber crop; also timber felling must be regulated to prevent waste and destruction. Describes how other natural resources add to the productivity of these states.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louis de Rochemont Associates and United World Films

results.title: Tropical lowland: the Amazon River, Brazil
results.creator_credit: Jules Bucher and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of series “The Earth and its peoples”
The Amazon River drains two-fifths of the continent of South America and varies in width from a mile to 800 miles at its mouth. Rain falls nearly every day, the climate hot and humid and the rain forest is almost impenetrable. Travel is almost entirely by water. Products are rosewood, brazil nuts, rubber, jute, cocoa. We are shown a family living in primitive conditions and the effect an unhealthy climate can have upon people and their development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jules Bucher and Louis de Rochemont Associates
